pr_title: Removes cloned fdlibm and uses openJDK's fdlibm instead

timeline.message:
Removes cloned fdlibm and uses openJDK's fdlibm instead

As discussed in
https://oss.oracle.com/pipermail/graalvm-dev/2020-May/000059.html

Since fdlibm is part of the OpenJDK and can be built as a separate
static library (already shipped with labsJDK) there is no apparent
reason for GraalVM to keep using an older clone of fdlibm.

Closes #2514

timeline.bodyText:
The Oracle copyright must remain the first line, the second one is then the Red Hat one. Also, it must be Red Hat Inc. without the ,.
Not my rules, that's what the lawyers agreed on...
When you do the change, please amend your commit and do a force push so that there is no intermediate commit with the wrong license header in the repository.
timeline.author: christianwimmer

timeline.bodyText: This definition is no longer necessary, the strictmath library no longer exists.
timeline.author: christianwimmer
